info.title: OMNA Commerce API
info.description:
# Introduction
* The OMNA Commerce API is built over REST services on HTTPS.
* It has predictable resource URLs.
* It returns HTTP response codes to indicate errors.
* It accepts and returns JSON in the HTTP body.
* You can use your favorite HTTP/REST library for your programming language to use OMNA Commerce API.

tags.name: Integrations
tags.description:
The term integration refers to resource set on which is possible operate, updated with the latest information, and consolidating information into a single processing workflow.

The available integrations are Lazada, Shopee.

tags.name: Flows
tags.description:
Operations about flows.

The flows allow to user configure a set of predetermined tasks to run on an integration. These tasks can be executed manually or automated through the configuration and activation of their schedulers. For example, the user can want to receive products form an integration 1 and orders form another integration.

tags.name: Webhooks
tags.description: A webhook is a hook through which a notification is sent to a URL of user choice when a certain event occurs. They allow to receive real-time HTTP notifications of changes to specific objects. Webhooks facilitate syncing and relaying data between two endpoints.

tags.name: Tasks
tags.description: Each of the actions that make up the api generate one or more tasks when are process. In the details of the task we can find information about the processing triggered by the action like status, fulfillment %, notifications, etc.

tags.name: Users
tags.description: User represent a person or a company, it is a user in Cenit System.

get.description: Returns the list of flows settings.

post.description: Create flow settings from a given name and channel.

get.description: Find flow by given id and returns it.

post.description: Find flow by given id and update it scheduler.

delete.description: Find flow by given id and destroy it.

get.description: Find flow by given id and destroy it.

Find flow by given id and start its processing.

> If exists any task of this flow in the execution or pending state, then the same task is returned, otherwise a new task is created.
Find flow by given id and activate or deactivate its scheduler.
Returns the list of your integrations.

post.description: Creates a new integration object from a given name and channel.

get.description: Find integration by given id and returns it.

delete.description:
Find integration by given id and destroy it.

> Only unauthorize integrations can be destroyed.

get.description: Find integration by given id and redirect navigation to authorization uri.

delete.description:
Find integration by given id and disallow their connection.

> Only authorize integrations can be unauthorizes.

get.description:
Find integration by given id and destroy it.

> Only unauthorize integrations can be destroyed.

get.summary: LIST ALL FLOWS FROM AN INTEGRATION
get.description: Returns the flow list of a specific integration.

get.summary: LIST ALL ORDERS FROM AN INTEGRATION
get.description: Returns the order list of a specific integration.

get.summary: RETRIVE AN ORDER FROM AN INTEGRATION
get.description: Find order by given id and returns it.

get.summary: RETRIEVE A DOCUMENT FROM AN ORDER
get.description:
Retrieve a specific document of the order.

> To reconstruct the file, the data from the node needs to be base64 decoded, and interpreted according to the mime_type.

get.summary: LIST ALL DOCUMENT TYPES FROM AN ORDER
get.description: Return the list of types of order documents

get.summary: IMPORT A SINGLE ORDER FROM AN INTEGRATION
get.description: Import a specific order from an integration
Import the last updated orders from an integration

Find integration by given id and disallow their connection.

> Only authorize integrations can be unauthorizes.
Returns the list of integration channels availables.
Returns the list of orders.

Authenticate in OMNA to obtain the token and the secret of the tenant of the authenticated user.

> The token and the secret will be sent to the given uri for the redirect (redirect_uri).
  You must save them for use in any other application to the OMNA API.
Returns the list of tasks executions.
Find task by given id and returns it.

delete.description:
Find task by given id and delete it.

> The task in running status can not be deleted.

get.description:
Find task by given id and destroy it.

> The task in running status can not be destroyed.

Find a task for the given id and retry its execution.

> Only failed tasks can be retry.
Returns the list of tenants of authenticated user.
Find tenant by given id and returns it.

delete.description: Find tenant by given id and delete it.

get.description: Find tenant by given id and destroy it.
Returns the list of webhooks settings.

post.description: Create webhook settings from a given topic, address and integration.

get.description: Find webhook by given id and returns it.

delete.description: Find webhook by given id and delete it.

post.description: Find webhook by given id and update it.

get.description: Find webhook by given id and destroy it.

CreatedAt.description: Date in iso8601 when the record was created

started_at.description: Date in iso8601 when the task was started

completed_at.description: Date in iso8601 when the task was completed

authorized.description: If integration is authorized or not

type.description: Notification type [info, notice, warning or error]

created_date.description: Date in iso8601 when the order was created

updated_date.description: Date in iso8601 when the order was updated

last_import_date.description: Date in iso8601 when the order was imported

name.description: Nombre legible del tipo de documento

start_date.description: Date from which the task will begin executing

end_date.description: Date from which the task will be stopped executing

time.description: Hour and minute in which the task will be executed

days_of_week.description: Days of the week in which the task will be executed

weeks_of_month.description: Weeks of the month in which the task will be executed

months_of_year.description: Months of the year in which the task will be executed

executions.description: Dates that started and completed each instance of execution of the task

secret.description: Secret key to sign each request

UpdatedAt.description: Date in iso8601 when the record was updated

example.message: Not found integration with id: shop_20

sign_in.description:
Redirect to given URI.

> Redirect to given URI passing the token and the secret of the tenant of the authenticated user.

### Example redirect to:
```
http://my.example.com/home?token=rXfNJmFUpsyv3zocVolI&secret=42b22ff1c8dd674c3912dbd2c79cc46682206cd8f2238c4faa8539a82e66bf38
```

schema.description: Keyed-Hash message authentication code.
The timestamp of the request with less than 7200 secounds difference from UTC time.
Tenant authentication token.
Document type
Flow identifier

Order number
Task identifier
Tenant identifier
Webhook identifier
Allow to filter the items by flow type.
Allow to filter the items by integration channel.
Allow to filter the items by integration.
Allow to filter the flows that contain the value of the term in their ***type***.
Allow to filter the integrations settings that contain the value of the term in their ***name***.
Allow to filter the orders that contain the value of the term in their ***number*** or ***status***.
Allow to filter the tasks that contain the value of the term in their ***status*** or ***description***.
Allow to filter the tenants that contain the value of the term in their ***name***.
Allow to filter the webhooks that contain the value of the term in their ***topic***.
Allow to filter the items by webhook topic.
The maximum number of items that can be returned. The supported values are between 10 and 100.
Number of items to skip at the beginning of the list.
URI to back after do sign_in or authorization
Allow to filter the tasks by ***status***.

Token.description: Tenant authentication token. The token of the tenant is obtained from the ***sign_in***. When the user registers through the ***sign_in*** action, as a result of the request, the information about the token is returned.
